availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Carter Page (Harrison County, Ky, Pentecostal pastor )

body.p: Logan County and Harrison County, Kentucky, minister. Virginia native. Son of Jane Page. Married to Sarah B. Miller Page in Harrison County, Kentucky, on January 6, 1853. Father of Elizabeth D. Page, Henry M. Page, and Isaac N. Page. Minister in Logan County in 1850. Pentecostal pastor in Cynthiana in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Cynthiana in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 2, p. 90A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 578.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 122.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216887.
"Rev Carter Page (1818-1893)," Find A Grave, Memorial #154367866, accessed January 12, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/154367866.
